column4: please look into my problem.. it's at -->http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=788746
why weren't u in here when i was miserable??? lol.. how'd you do that?
google's dns seems to resolve differently on different nameservers.  Your current DNS servers may be the problem
am i to ask my isp to change my DNS?
you can change your DNS servers in your network settings.
208.67.222.222 and 208.67.220.220 usually work for me.  They're OpenDNS's servers
as far as i now, it's automatically resolved by my ISP. dynamic not static service package.. i can be able to do that?
as far as i now, it's automatically resolved by my ISP. dynamic not static service package.. i can be able to do that?
care to walk me through it? im connecting via PPPoE adsl modem
I don't know how to do it with pppoe
i see where to change the DNSs.. do i delete the ones i have now, or just add the OpenDNS ones?
add the opendns ones before the ones you have not
I think it's for the whole system
ok.. thank you. you have just alleviated my three-day misery
